mainBoard.flavorText:
"I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My Betrayal is certain—but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say."
—Jolrael
mainBoard.name: Nekrataal
mainBoard.originalText:
First strike
When Nekrataal comes into play, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it’s a creature you control.

mainBoard.text:

mainBoard.flavorText: Phyrexia wastes nothing. Its food chain is a spiraling cycle.
mainBoard.name: Phyrexian Ghoul
mainBoard.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Phyrexian Ghoul gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice a creature: Phyrexian Ghoul gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

mainBoard.name: Sengir Vampire
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, if Sengir Vampire dealt damage to it this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

mainBoard.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."
—Sitrik, birth priest
mainBoard.name: Exhume
mainBoard.originalText: Each player puts a creature card from his or her graveyard into play.
mainBoard.text: Each player puts a creature card from their graveyard onto the battlefield.

mainBoard.name: Living Death
mainBoard.originalText: Set aside all creature cards in all graveyards. Then put each creature that's in play into its owner's graveyard. Then put each creature card set aside this way into play under its owner's control.

rulings.text: As Living Death resolves, all players exile their creature cards from graveyards at the same time. Then all players sacrifice all creatures they control at the same time. Then all players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield at the same time.

Only cards exiled by Living Death's first instruction are put onto the battlefield. If a replacement effect (such as that of Leyline of the Void) causes any of the sacrificed creatures to be exiled instead of put into a graveyard, those cards aren't returned to the battlefield.

mainBoard.text: Each player exiles all creature cards from their graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures they control, then puts all cards they exiled this way onto the battlefield.

mainBoard.name: Reanimate
mainBoard.originalText: Put target creature card from a graveyard into play under your control. You lose life equal to that creature's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: If a card in a player's graveyard has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.
If any abilities trigger on the creature entering the battlefield, those abilities resolve after you lose life. If losing life results in you losing the game, those abilities won't resolve.
In a multiplayer game, if a player leaves the game, all cards that player owns leave as well. If you leave the game, the creature you control from Reanimate is exiled.
The amount of life you lose is determined by the mana value of the card in your graveyard, not the creature once it's on the battlefield.
You lose life after the creature is already on the battlefield. Any abilities it has that interact with loss of life, such as that of Platinum Emperion, apply to that loss of life.

mainBoard.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its mana value.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the *Predator*. "It is Greven's mind manifest."
mainBoard.name: Rolling Thunder
mainBoard.originalText: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

rulings.text: If X is 0, you can’t choose any targets.
If Rolling Thunder is copied, the copy will retain the original damage divsion. The spell or ability will likely allow you to choose new targets, but you can’t change the way damage is divided.

If some, but not all, of the targets become illegal by the time Rolling Thunder tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies, but no damage is dealt to illegal targets. If all the targets are illegal, the spell won’t resolve.
You choose how many targets Rolling Thunder has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

mainBoard.text: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.

mainBoard.name: Syphon Soul
mainBoard.originalText: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
mainBoard.text: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

mainBoard.name: Pestilence
mainBoard.originalText:
At end of turn, if there are no creatures in play, sacrifice Pestilence.
oo
B Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.
Note that “until end of turn” effects wear off after “at the beginning of the end step” triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
